availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Native of Kentucky. Worked as an attorney and notary public in Louisville. Active in Democratic politics.

Spouse: Whartie L Hoke
Children: Nancy Hoke

bibl.p: Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 6, page 66.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 3, page 131.
The Louisville Daily Courier, "Democratic Meeting in the First and Second Wards," April 18, 1859, page 1.
U.S. Find a Grave Index, 1600-Present, "William Beard Hoke," https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=50326019&ref=acom accessed 05/11/2017.
